forecast.name: New Year's Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. East southeast wind around 5 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the dawn presents a mostly cloudy canvas overhead, the low humidity tugging at the edges of the marine layer that dances along the horizon, hinting at its presence but not obscuring the city’s silhouette just yet. With temperatures resting in a cool embrace around 48, the air carries a crispness that invites the early risers to step out into the new year. As the sun ascends, a gentle warmth begins to weave its way through the clouds, revealing hints of the day ahead—a partly sunny spectacle poised to reach a modest 57 degrees by midday.

The atmospheric clarity ranges from soft to shimmering, with pockets of brightness emerging as the day moves on, scattering the grey and coaxing the bustling life of the city into motion. While the fog may linger closer to the coast, it is the urban landscape that demands attention—streetcars gliding along, cyclists weaving through the early morning chill, and the scent of coffee wafting from corner cafés once again. Dressing in layers is wise, perhaps a light jacket accompanied by a scarf to stave off the remnants of night, as one navigates this transitional morning. Given the forecast, a stroll through Golden Gate Park, a visit to the Ferry Building Marketplace, or even a leisurely read at a favorite café seems not only pleasant but a lovely way to savor this first day of the year in a city brimming with quiet charm.
